intro: Planera keaki, commonly known as the Hawaiian planera, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its bark is smooth and grayish, and it produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, Planera keaki is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
